12:01 <chanikag> has quit  
12:04 <@cjdelisle> When you were setting up Extensions wiki, was the contributers property added after some extensions had already been imported?  
12:09 <vmassol> I do'nt think so  
12:10 <fmancinelli> Hi everybody, I've found something that is a bug but I don't know if it's already known: apparently wiki macros with "global" visibility are not registered on a xar import in an empty wiki. I have an "enriched" xar with a"global" wiki macro. If I import that xar on an empty wiki the macro is not there. If I change the visibility to "current wiki" the macro is correctly registered on import. Does this make a bell sound?  
12:11 <@cjdelisle> Extension.AllBrokenAttachments contributers field is a StringProperty which is incorrect, it should be a StringListProperty.  
12:12 <@cjdelisle> What you are experiencing is a reincarnation of XWIKI-299  
12:24 <@cjdelisle> What is happening is you saved ExtensionCode.ExtensionClass and it caused the key xwiki:ExtensionCode.ExtensionClass:en to be evicted from the cache.  
12:26 <@cjdelisle> Since language is not part of the document reference, when somebody next added a contributer to the document, it called getDocument which loaded xwiki:ExtensionCode.ExtensionClass from the cache (no :en)  
12:27 <@cjdelisle> Ofc that was the old version of the class and since the document wasn't saved again the incorrect properiy lingered.  
12:27 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-6170  
12:33 <@cjdelisle> XWIKI-6566

15:50 <vmassol> sdumitriu: the jira git integration should be ok now  
15:50 <@sdumitriu> What was broken?  
15:51 <vmassol> first it wasn't pointing to the right locations and just now the xwiki-platform mapping wasn't activated  
15:51 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
15:51 <vmassol> (and I asked guillaume F to do the local git clone)  
15:51 <@sdumitriu> But it used to work yesterday  
15:51 <vmassol> even for xwiki-platform?  
15:52 <vmassol> bcause it was makeed as inactive  
15:52 <vmassol> marked  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> You're talking about linking from Jira to Git, right?  
15:52 <vmassol> I'm talking about http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/secure/ViewGitRepositories.jspa  
15:52 <vmassol> yes  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:52 <vmassol> the first entry in the list was inactive  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> Strange  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> Yesterday it was working  
15:53 <vmassol> you finished the config yesterday?  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> I saw it in practice with mflorea  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> Changeset Format and all the rest  
15:53 <vmassol> ok  
15:54 <@sdumitriu> Did someone else play with it?  
15:54 <vmassol> I don't think so  
15:56 <@cjdelisle> hi pulasthi I say you highlighted me yesterday. What's on your mind?  
16:17 <lucaa> has quit  
16:18 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: ahh was just curious about the how gsoc selection were going :)  
16:19 <@sdumitriu> Really tough  
17:05 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
17:06 <drake01> has quit  
17:16 <mflorea> has quit  
17:27 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
17:33 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Can I declare a dependency on a list of component implementations on one of the components itself?  
17:33 <vmassol> sdumitriu: not sure I understad  
17:33 <vmassol> you can inject a list of components yes  
17:33 <vmassol> @Inject List<MYComponentRoleClass> impls;  
17:34 <vmassol> (or Map)  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> I have a factory component that should iterate over all the other implementations trying to find the right factory implementation  
17:34 <vmassol> the best for factory  
17:34 <vmassol> is to do it dynamically  
17:34 <vmassol> ie grab the CM  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> Right  
17:34 <vmassol> and do a lookupList  
17:34 <@sdumitriu> That was the alternative  
17:34 <vmassol> that's if we want to support adding a new etxension at runtime  
17:35 <vmassol> otherwise you can do static injection  
17:35 <vmassol> with @Inject List<>  
17:35 <vmassol> in the future  
17:35 <vmassol> I'd like to introduce a proxy solution  
17:35 <vmassol> as it's done in CDI  
17:36 <vmassol> (trying to find the link in the cdi doc)  
17:38 <vmassol> http://code.google.com/p/jee6-cdi/wiki/DependencyInjectionAnIntroductoryTutorial\_Part2#Advanced:\_Using\_Instance\_to\_inject\_transports  
17:38 <vmassol> (using Instance)  
17:40 <vmassol> example:  
17:40 <vmassol> @Inject Instance<TextTranslator> textTranslatorInstance;  
17:40 <vmassol> ...  
17:40 <vmassol> public void translate() {  
17:40 <vmassol>    textTranslatorInstance.get().translate(inputText);  
17:40 <vmassol> }  
17:40 <vmassol> in practice the get does the lookup  
17:41 <vmassol> it avoids having to know about the CM  
17:41 <@sdumitriu> Nice  
17:42 <vmassol> you'd like this one:  
17:42 <vmassol> @Inject   
17:42 <vmassol> void initServices(@Any Instance<Service> services) {   
17:42 <vmassol>    for (Service service: services) {  
17:42 <vmassol>       service.init();  
17:42 <vmassol>    }  
17:42 <vmassol> }  
17:43 <vmassol> some more info here: http://docs.jboss.org/weld/reference/1.0.1-Final/en-US/html\_single/#lookup  
17:48 <vmassol> has quit  
17:55 <supreet> hey, I was working on the bug http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6491 . I found a workaround but I need to know what value does "$xwiki.tag.getDocumentsWithTag($tag)" return when no documents are found to match the tag.  
17:56 <supreet> if someone could help me , the source can be found at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-tag/xwiki-platform-tag-ui/src/main/resources/Main/Tags.xml  
17:58 <@sdumitriu> You should look at the sources of the tag plugin, https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-tag/xwiki-platform-tag-api/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/tag/TagPluginApi.java  
17:59 <supreet> ok , i ll check it . Thanx :)  
17:59 <@sdumitriu> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-tag/xwiki-platform-tag-api/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/tag/TagPlugin.java#L296  
18:00 <@sdumitriu> In short, it returns an empty list  
18:00 <supreet> actually I need to create an "if-else" condition  
18:00 <supreet> so I need the value  
18:02 <supreet> I ve even written the workaround to limit the activity macro in case of no results but I need the value to make the "if-else" condition run  
18:03 <@sdumitriu> if (result.isEmpty())  
18:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
18:03 <supreet> ok i ll check it  
18:22 <Denis> has quit  
18:23 <supreet> hey sdumitriu, the 'if condition' you specified seems incomplete as it is not involving "$xwiki.tag.getDocumentsWithTag($tag)" . I tried to incorporate it myself but I couldnt.  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> #if ($xwiki.tag.getDocumentsWithTag($tag).isEmpty())  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> ...  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> #else  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> ...  
18:25 <@sdumitriu> #end  
18:25 <fmancinelli> has quit  
18:26 <supreet> :)  
18:26 <supreet> thanx
